title: UNHCR Niger
subtitle: @UNHCRNiger started biometric registration in #Maradi where 35,055 Nigerian refugees have found safety since May 2019. Together with @UNHCR_Morelli, the Secretary General visited the registration site in Dan Kano, providing support to UNHCR & partners' response.pic.twitter.com/uk9uup3JDe

title: Jean Bosco Iyacu
subtitle: Today @AFRwanda and @FSDAfrica in collaboration with @UMUTANGUHA1 and @MTNRwanda are excited to launch   saving/loan products in Mahama Camp hosting refugees from #Burundi for improved well-being. Thanks to @UKinRwanda @MastercardFdn @SwedeninRW @USAIDRwandapic.twitter.com/IYQVw6wPXp

title: Save the Children Uganda
subtitle:
Meet some of the amazing members of our Uganda team! 

Christine, Yumalu and Rukiah are three #SavetheChildren midwives working to deliver healthy babies in Bidi Bidi refugee settlement. Many pregnant women come to the clinic under-nourished or with complications #meettheteampic.twitter.com/ahY3Wkm3rH

title: Amira Elfadil Mohammed Elfadil
subtitle: Government of Rwanda, UNHCR and African Union agree to evacuate refugees and asylum seekers in Libya through an MoU signed today. @_AfricanUnion @AUC_MoussaFaki @RwandainAddis @UNHCR_AU @AbdoulayeDiop8pic.twitter.com/pDD0WcRSMK

title: UNHCR Uganda
subtitle:
Imagine if you were forced to flee your home to save yourself.

Imagine if you were then told you couldn’t finish school because you had no way of proving all your previous hard work. 

This is the reality for thousands of refugee children. http://trib.al/eXMDFaJ pic.twitter.com/5ke9T9HVMq

title: Zayed Bakhresa
subtitle:

Something interesting I found out about them (Burundi refugees) is that, they are to be sent back on October 1st.

title: CRSUganda
subtitle: Isn’t it wonderful to see children enjoy their childhood, even in a #refugee settlement? We are supporting refugee families in #Bidibidi, #Kiryandongo & #Kyangwali Refugee Settlements with wash, sanitation, shelter, education and more to ensure their basic needs are met. pic.twitter.com/k38dXDgps0

title: Alex Ayub
subtitle: #StepForSafety Walk in support for people who have been forced to flee their homes was a great learning experience. title: #RiseUpForRefugees
subtitle: Yesterday at the #RefugeeTeaParty , we had an opportunity to learn how to make liquid soap. We plan on organizing more of such training sessions so as to empower refugees with skills which can be a source of income for better livelihoods. Which training should we conduct next? pic.twitter.com/sLX4LmAxrc
